 }

   "github_updated_at": "2026-02-07T16:47:36Z",
   "body_snippet": "<!--- Provide a general summary of the issue in the Title above -->\r\n\r\n## Expected Behavior\r\n\r\nI expect to connect to the machine via RDP without entering credentials.\r\n\r\n## Current Behavior\r\n\r\nFor some machines, when I attempt to connect to an RDP server, I get the message **\"server's authentication policy does not allow connection requests using saved credentials\"**  and I must type in the password to connect.  However, when I use the built-in Windows RDP client, I don't get the same message. ...",
-  "our_status": "new",
-  "priority": null,
+  "our_status": "triaged",
+  "priority": "P2-bug",
   "target_release": null,
   "our_branch": null,
   "our_pr": null,
-  "iterations": [],
+  "iterations": [
+    {
+      "seq": 1,
+      "date": "2026-02-17",
+      "type": "triaged",
+      "description": "Suspected to be an external Windows Group Policy issue (credential delegation) rather than an application bug; awaiting user confirmation."
+    }
+  ],
   "comments": [
     {
       "id": "MDEyOklzc3VlQ29tbWVudDQwNjI4MDE2Nw==",
@@ -42,5 +49,5 @@
   "needs_action": true,
   "waiting_for_us": false,
   "last_synced": "2026-02-15T09:52:50Z",
-  "notes": ""
+  "notes": "AI triage (gemini): Suspected to be an external Windows Group Policy issue (credential delegation) rather than an application bug; awaiting user confirmation.\nApproach: Request feedback on whether GPO settings resolved the issue; close if no response."
 }

   "github_updated_at": "2026-02-07T19:54:07Z",
   "body_snippet": "<!--- Provide a general summary of the issue in the Title above -->\r\nWith 1.76 Alpha and imported connections from RDMan, save of ConfCons fails, leaving a zero-byte file behind.  That in turn throws an exception at next mRemoteNG launch.\r\n\r\n## Expected Behavior\r\nConnection file should get saved :-)\r\n\r\n## Current Behavior\r\nError writing ConfCons.xml due to an null value inside, which is not identified.\r\nLog snippet:\r\n\r\n2018-07-11 08:45:38,005 [1] ERROR - SaveToXml failed\r\nValue cannot be null.\r\n...",
-  "our_status": "new",
-  "priority": null,
+  "our_status": "triaged",
+  "priority": "P2-bug",
   "target_release": null,
   "our_branch": null,
   "our_pr": null,

+      "seq": 1,
+      "date": "2026-02-17",
+      "type": "triaged",
+      "description": "The issue reports a critical failure (unable to save config) but is dated (v1.77.2) and lacks reproduction steps or logs. Verification on the latest build is required to confirm if it persists."
+    }
+  ],
   "comments": [
     {
       "id": "MDEyOklzc3VlQ29tbWVudDQ1MTg1NzExMw==",
@@ -53,5 +60,5 @@

   "waiting_for_us": false,
   "last_synced": "2026-02-15T09:52:50Z",
-  "notes": ""
+  "notes": "AI triage (gemini): The issue reports a critical failure (unable to save config) but is dated (v1.77.2) and lacks reproduction steps or logs. Verification on the latest build is required to confirm if it persists.\nApproach: Request detailed logs and reproduction steps on the latest version. If reproducible, investigate XmlConnectionsSaver.cs for file locking, permission handling, or serialization errors."
 }

diff --git a/.project-roadmap/issues-db/upstream/1041.json b/.project-roadmap/issues-db/upstream/1041.json
index b4efc4285..3043de6f8 100644
--- a/.project-roadmap/issues-db/upstream/1041.json
+++ b/.project-roadmap/issues-db/upstream/1041.json
@@ -12,12 +12,19 @@
   "created_at": "2018-07-25T07:17:25Z",
   "github_updated_at": "2026-02-07T19:54:17Z",
   "body_snippet": "Hello.\r\nI did not find such feature, which seems to exist in every other remote connection tool (like Putty, SecureCRT, Superputty). If it is not there, I propose:\r\nAdd to mRemoteNG a feature, allowing to Open a connection via a CMD in a new Tab.\r\n\r\nSyntax could be like this:\r\n`mremoteng --connection \"/connections/interxion/myswitch123\" --newtab`\r\n\r\nAlso you could implement new connection, like this:\r\n`mremoteng  --host myserver.io --port 12345 --protocol ssh2 --username admin --password ADm1n -...",
-  "our_status": "new",
-  "priority": null,
+  "our_status": "triaged",
+  "priority": "P3-enhancement",
   "target_release": null,
   "our_branch": null,
   "our_pr": null,
-  "iterations": [],
+  "iterations": [
+    {
+      "seq": 1,
+      "date": "2026-02-17",
+      "type": "triaged",
+      "description": "The current single-instance logic switches focus to the running instance but fails to pass the command-line arguments (like `--connect`) to it, requiring an IPC mechanism (e.g., Named Pipes) to be added."
+    }
+  ],
   "comments": [
     {
       "id": "MDEyOklzc3VlQ29tbWVudDQ1NTIzMTE2OQ==",
@@ -70,5 +77,5 @@
   "needs_action": true,
   "waiting_for_us": false,
   "last_synced": "2026-02-15T09:52:50Z",
-  "notes": ""
+  "notes": "AI triage (gemini): The current single-instance logic switches focus to the running instance but fails to pass the command-line arguments (like `--connect`) to it, requiring an IPC mechanism (e.g., Named Pipes) to be added.\nApproach: Implement a Named Pipe server in ProgramRoot to listen for arguments from subsequent instances; refactor StartupArgumentsInterpreter to handle runtime requests."
 }

diff --git a/mRemoteNG/App/ProgramRoot.cs b/mRemoteNG/App/ProgramRoot.cs
index 2bd637a8c..4a8b0a9e5 100644
--- a/mRemoteNG/App/ProgramRoot.cs
+++ b/mRemoteNG/App/ProgramRoot.cs
@@ -5,6 +5,7 @@ using mRemoteNG.Config.Settings;
 using mRemoteNG.DotNet.Update;
 using mRemoteNG.UI.Forms;
 using mRemoteNG.Resources.Language;
+using mRemoteNG.Tools.Cmdline;
 using System;
 using System.Diagnostics;
 using System.Drawing;
@@ -170,14 +171,83 @@ namespace mRemoteNG.App
             _mutex = new Mutex(false, mutexID, out bool newInstanceCreated);
             if (!newInstanceCreated)
             {
+                // Try to pass command line arguments to the existing instance
+                if (SingleInstanceIPCHandler.SendArgsToExistingInstance(Environment.GetCommandLineArgs()))
+                {
+                    return;
+                }
+
                 SwitchToCurrentInstance();
                 return;
             }
 
+            // Start IPC Server to listen for arguments from other instances
+            SingleInstanceIPCHandler ipcHandler = new();
+            ipcHandler.StartServer(HandleRuntimeArguments);
+
             StartApplication();
+            
+            ipcHandler.StopServer();
             GC.KeepAlive(_mutex);
         }
 
+        private static void HandleRuntimeArguments(string[] args)
+        {
+            // Wait for FrmMain to be created and handle to be ready
+            // This prevents race conditions if a request comes in during startup
+            int retries = 0;
+            while ((!FrmMain.IsCreated || !FrmMain.Default.IsHandleCreated) && retries < 100)
+            {
+                Thread.Sleep(100);
+                retries++;
+            }
+
+            if (!FrmMain.IsCreated || !FrmMain.Default.IsHandleCreated)
+                return;
+
+            if (FrmMain.Default.InvokeRequired)
+            {
+                FrmMain.Default.Invoke(new Action<string[]>(HandleRuntimeArguments), new object[] { args });
+                return;
+            }
+
+            try
+            {
+                // Bring window to front
+                if (FrmMain.Default.WindowState == FormWindowState.Minimized)
+                    FrmMain.Default.WindowState = FormWindowState.Normal;
+                
+                FrmMain.Default.Activate();
+                NativeMethods.SetForegroundWindow(FrmMain.Default.Handle);
+
+                // Parse arguments
+                CmdArgumentsInterpreter parser = new(args);
+                string? connectTo = parser["connect"];
+                
+                // Also check for 'startup' argument if connect is missing
+                if (string.IsNullOrEmpty(connectTo))
+                    connectTo = parser["startup"];
+
+                if (!string.IsNullOrEmpty(connectTo))
+                {
+                    // Find root node
+                    var connectionTreeModel = Runtime.ConnectionsService.ConnectionTreeModel;
+                    if (connectionTreeModel != null)
+                    {
+                        var rootNode = System.Linq.Enumerable.FirstOrDefault(connectionTreeModel.RootNodes) as mRemoteNG.Tree.Root.RootNodeInfo;
+                        if (rootNode != null)
+                        {
+                            new mRemoteNG.Tree.CommandLineConnectionOpener(Runtime.ConnectionInitiator, connectTo, "IPC Argument").Execute(rootNode);
+                        }
+                    }
+                }
+            }
+            catch (Exception ex)
+            {
+                Runtime.MessageCollector.AddExceptionMessage("Error handling runtime arguments", ex);
+            }
+        }
+
         private static void SwitchToCurrentInstance()
         {
             IntPtr singletonInstanceWindowHandle = GetRunningSingletonInstanceWindowHandle();

   "body_snippet": "Hello.\r\nI did not find such feature, which seems to exist in every other remote connection tool (like Putty, SecureCRT, Superputty). If it is not there, I propose:\r\nAdd to mRemoteNG a feature, allowing to Open a connection via a CMD in a new Tab.\r\n\r\nSyntax could be like this:\r\n`mremoteng --connection \"/connections/interxion/myswitch123\" --newtab`\r\n\r\nAlso you could implement new connection, like this:\r\n`mremoteng  --host myserver.io --port 12345 --protocol ssh2 --username admin --password ADm1n -...",

+  "notes": "AI triage (gemini): The current single-instance logic switches focus to the running instance but fails to pass the command-line arguments (like `--connect`) to it, requiring an IPC mechanism (e.g., Named Pipes) to be added.\nApproach: Implement a Named Pipe server in ProgramRoot to listen for arguments from subsequent instances; refactor StartupArgumentsInterpreter to handle runtime requests."
 }

diff --git a/mRemoteNG/App/ProgramRoot.cs b/mRemoteNG/App/ProgramRoot.cs
index 2bd637a8c..4a8b0a9e5 100644
--- a/mRemoteNG/App/ProgramRoot.cs
+++ b/mRemoteNG/App/ProgramRoot.cs
@@ -5,6 +5,7 @@ using mRemoteNG.Config.Settings;
 using mRemoteNG.DotNet.Update;
 using mRemoteNG.UI.Forms;
 using mRemoteNG.Resources.Language;
+using mRemoteNG.Tools.Cmdline;
 using System;
 using System.Diagnostics;
 using System.Drawing;
@@ -170,14 +171,83 @@ namespace mRemoteNG.App
             _mutex = new Mutex(false, mutexID, out bool newInstanceCreated);
             if (!newInstanceCreated)
             {
+                // Try to pass command line arguments to the existing instance
+                if (SingleInstanceIPCHandler.SendArgsToExistingInstance(Environment.GetCommandLineArgs()))
+                {
+                    return;
+                }
+
                 SwitchToCurrentInstance();
                 return;
             }
 
+            // Start IPC Server to listen for arguments from other instances
+            SingleInstanceIPCHandler ipcHandler = new();
+            ipcHandler.StartServer(HandleRuntimeArguments);
+
             StartApplication();
+            
+            ipcHandler.StopServer();
             GC.KeepAlive(_mutex);
         }
 
+        private static void HandleRuntimeArguments(string[] args)
+        {
+            // Wait for FrmMain to be created and handle to be ready
+            // This prevents race conditions if a request comes in during startup
+            int retries = 0;
+            while ((!FrmMain.IsCreated || !FrmMain.Default.IsHandleCreated) && retries < 100)
+            {
+                Thread.Sleep(100);
+                retries++;
+            }
+
+            if (!FrmMain.IsCreated || !FrmMain.Default.IsHandleCreated)
+                return;
+
+            if (FrmMain.Default.InvokeRequired)
+            {
+                FrmMain.Default.Invoke(new Action<string[]>(HandleRuntimeArguments), new object[] { args });
+                return;
+            }
+
+            try
+            {
+                // Bring window to front
+                if (FrmMain.Default.WindowState == FormWindowState.Minimized)
+                    FrmMain.Default.WindowState = FormWindowState.Normal;
+                
+                FrmMain.Default.Activate();
+                NativeMethods.SetForegroundWindow(FrmMain.Default.Handle);
+
+                // Parse arguments
+                CmdArgumentsInterpreter parser = new(args);
+                string? connectTo = parser["connect"];
+                
+                // Also check for 'startup' argument if connect is missing
+                if (string.IsNullOrEmpty(connectTo))
+                    connectTo = parser["startup"];
+
+                if (!string.IsNullOrEmpty(connectTo))
+                {
+                    // Find root node
+                    var connectionTreeModel = Runtime.ConnectionsService.ConnectionTreeModel;
+                    if (connectionTreeModel != null)
+                    {
+                        var rootNode = System.Linq.Enumerable.FirstOrDefault(connectionTreeModel.RootNodes) as mRemoteNG.Tree.Root.RootNodeInfo;
+                        if (rootNode != null)
+                        {
+                            new mRemoteNG.Tree.CommandLineConnectionOpener(Runtime.ConnectionInitiator, connectTo, "IPC Argument").Execute(rootNode);
+                        }
+                    }
+                }
+            }
+            catch (Exception ex)
+            {
+                Runtime.MessageCollector.AddExceptionMessage("Error handling runtime arguments", ex);
+            }
+        }
+
         private static void SwitchToCurrentInstance()
         {
             IntPtr singletonInstanceWindowHandle = GetRunningSingletonInstanceWindowHandle();
